section.title: The Job Control Tab
section.para: GêBr presents an interface to the organization and visualization of the results.
As seen in , GêBR switches to the Job Control Tab whenever a Flow is executed.

listitem.para: Righ Panel: Details of a selected job

section.title: Toolbar
section.para: In this tab you can follow and, if so desired, interrupt the Flow's execution. The available commands are:

listitem.para: Save the Job's information in a file

section.title: Save
section.para: Save to disk the output of the selected flow up to the moment.

section.title: Clear
section.para: Eliminate from the job Control the selected Job. Caution is needed because the process is irreversible.

section.title: Left Panel
section.para: In the left panel, GêBR presents a list of flows executed by you, ordered by moment of execution. Each exhibited flow can be in one of three states:

section.section:
Right panel
In the upper part, information of the selected flow is exhibited. More informations are shown clicking over Details. Among the exhibited information there are:
moment of start/finish of the flow
input/output files
servers group in which the flow were executed
You can also consult which machines were effectively used in the group and how the distribution of the work was done by clicking over
.
The provided informations are:
GêBR-maestro machine
GêBR-client machine
Total number of processors used in the execution
Distributions of the jobs to the servers
The results (standard output) of the flow are shown. The redirected output are not exhibited. Right-clicking on this window, an options menu is exhibited, by which you can enable the automatic word wrap and the automatic scroll of window as the output is being shown.
You can also consult the command lines executed by GêBR. You just need to visit the tab Command line. The command lines are portable and can be copy-pasted through a execution terminal.
